author: Blog Staff
description:
Variadic templates are a powerful C++ feature that allow template classes or functions to accept an arbitrary number of parameters. In this article, we’ll explore how to combine them with class templates and examine the various ways the parameter pack can be expanded.

Variadic Class Template Arguments

by Sandor Dargo

From the article:

Let’s talk about class templates and variadic parameters. How to use them in combination?

But first of all, what are variadic templates?

Variadic template don’t accept a fixed size of parameters, but anything from one to more. The set of parameters is called the parameter pack.
title: Variadic Class Template Arguments -- Sandor Dargo
